Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] "http scheme specific part is too short: //"
 https://
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=F4cRqr-xjgf2vYUplR-7N6iXcRD9NE4uMWDZcDJuJGEv
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

The 'uri-errors.log' file captures lots of little errors where something 
that appeared in the context where it should or might be a URI turns out 
to have parsing problems. Almost always, these are due to problems on 
sites -- and aren't anything a crawl operator could or should address.

We log them just in case we need to go back and look closely at page 
potential-URI content that never even reached enqueueing (and thus 
didn't appear as success/failure/retry in other logs). I'd ignore this 
logs' contents unless/until you're investigating some specific issue 
that you think might be explained by atypical/corrupt page URI content.

- Gordon @ IA

On 7/16/10 10:32 AM, gomwi01 wrote:
> Hi. I am receiving the following message -->"http scheme specific part is too short: //" https://, when attempting to crawl. Has anyone else experienced these errors in the uri-errors.log file before? If so, what should I adjust to get around this roadblock? Thanks!
